Definition at line 312 of file cmd_server.cpp.

bool CmdServer::cmd_service ( marty_msgs::Command::Request &  req,
marty_msgs::Command::Response &  res 
)
private

Handles server command queue.

If the server is not busy (currently handling a command), approves the request, copies the data (command) and submits a success boolean.

Parameters
reqIncoming command request, contains command instructions
resResponse from the command server to the client. True is successful, false if unsuccessful.

void CmdServer::eyes ( int  amount = 0,
int  amount2 = 0 
)
private

Moves the eyes.

Moves the eye servo by an amount. Note: currently the eyes are controlled by one servo, therefore unable to move independent of each other.

Parameters
amountAmount to move the eyes by
amount2Redundant, for now...

Definition at line 229 of file cmd_server.cpp.

void CmdServer::getData ( int  sensor,
int  id 
)
private

General function to obtain sensor data.

Obtains data from a sensor.
Sensors: GPIOs (GET_GPIO), accelerometer (GET_ACCEL), battery (GET_BATT), servo current (GET_CURR), ball position (GET_BALL)
IDs: GPIOs (1 to 8), accelerometer (AXES_X, AXES_Y, AXES_Z), servo current (1 to 8), ball position (AXES_X, AXES_Y)

Parameters
sensorWhich sensor to read
idWhich aspect of the sensor to obtain data, i.e X-axis of the accelerometer

Performs a lean.

Generates a leaning trajectory, in a specified direction (forward, backwards, left, right) and runs it.

Parameters
dirDirection of lean (CMD_LEFT, CMD_RIGHT, CMD_FORW, CMD_BACK)
amountIntensity of lean
move_timeTime taken for movement

Definition at line 300 of file cmd_server.cpp.

void CmdServer::lifeCB ( const ros::TimerEvent &  e)
private

Callback function for handling lifelike movements.

Randomly chooses a pre-defined movement to move Marty. Movements are triggered by a ROS Timer, life_timer_. Once triggered, a random number determines the movement to be performed.

Parameters
eTimerEvent provided by ROS Timer life_timer_

Here is where you may add new functions for Marty to do. Don't forget to create a CmdServer::function() as well as its definition in the cmd_server.hpp

Toggles the state of Marty's lifelike behaviour.

Parameters
enableDetermines the state of the lifelike behaviour (TRUE = enabled, FALSE = disabled)

Definition at line 667 of file cmd_server.cpp.

void CmdServer::swingArms ( int  r_arm,
int  l_arm,
int  duration = 2000,
int  cycles = 4 
)
private

Swings arms.

Swings Marty's arms according to a sine curve of values i.e arm angle = mult*sin(alpha).

Parameters
r_armRight arm multiplier, a negative number will produce movement in the opposite direction
l_armLeft arm multiplier, a negative number will produce movement in the opposite direction
durationTime taken for arm movement
cyclesDetermines angular increment, where inc = (1.57*cycles)/steps

Definition at line 489 of file cmd_server.cpp.

void CmdServer::swingJoints ( marty_msgs::ServoMsgArray  servo_array,
int  duration = 2000,
int  cycles = 4 
)
private

Swings a joint.

Swings one of Marty's joints according to a sine curve of values i.e arm angle = mult*sin(alpha). Similar to the method employed in swingArms().

Parameters
servo_arrayAn array of servo movement values, of type marty_msgs::ServoMsgArray
durationTime taken for joint movement
cyclesDetermines angular increment, where inc = (1.57*cycles)/steps
